roleset.name: earn profits
roleset.note: GROSS-V NOTES: Frames file for 'gross' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry. (from gross.01-v)

example.name: in a noun phrase
example.text: ``Batman'' alone has racked up more than $247 million in box-office receipts to date, making it Warner Bros.' largest grossing film ever.

roleset.name: examine or study for tissue changes as a whole and without the use of an aid (ie a microscope)
roleset.note: GROSS-V NOTES: Based on temprel medical data. No comparison. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from gross.02-v)

example.name: Single arg
example.text: Simply enter the Net amount in the white box above, select whether the amount is Gross, Net. 25, or the GST, and the calculator works out the rest.

roleset.name: visible to the naked eye; be able to see without a microscope
roleset.note: GROSS-J NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Framed by Katie. (from gross.04-j)

example.name: look at pathology with the naked eye

roleset.name: disgusting, crude
roleset.note: GROSS-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. (from gross.01-j)

role.descr: perceiver of grossness, gross to whom?

example.name: Practically incomprehensible ambergris example. Look it up.
example.text: The stuff the eject is fould and gross , but after it floats in the sun , on the ocean , for many years , it becomes ambergris - worth a small fortune too .....

example.name: All args
example.text: This place is so gross to me.

roleset.name: conspicuous, flagrant
roleset.note: GROSS-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. (from gross.02-j)

roles.note: May require concatenation if action is flagrant thing, and agent of action is separated from action itself. (from gross.02-j)
